scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains records from the organization on various campaigns, especially disarmament, nuclear non-proliferation, anti-World Trade Oorganization actions, anti-corporate campaigns, and labor issues. Genres of documents include correspondence, clippings, meeting minutes, reports, newsletters, and flyers. The collection also contains some of the fundraising and financial documents generated by WILPF. The majority of the documents date from the 1980's and 1990's. PLEASE DIRECT FURTHER INQUIRIES TO: peter.filardo@nyu.edu

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1915, the Women's International League for Peace and Freedom is an activist organization addressing a variety of issues including world disarmament, full rights for women, racial and economic justice, and ending all forms of violence.
